required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on December 01, 2015
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Bioequivalency Study of 600 mg Oxcarbazepine Tablets Under Fasting Conditions
clinical_study.official_title: A Single Dose, Two-Treatment, Two-Period, Two-Sequence Crossover Bioequivalency Study of Oxcarbazepine 600 mg Tablets Under Fasting Conditions

brief_summary.textblock: The objective of this study was to assess the bioequivalence of a potential generic 600 mg oxcarbazepine tablet formulation compared with Novartis Pharmaceutical's 600 mg oxcarbazepine tablet, Trileptal, following a single 600 mg dose administered under fasting conditions.

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Bio-equivalence Study, Intervention Model: Crossover Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Treatment

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- No clinically significant abnormal finding on the physical examination, medical history, or clinical labratory results duirng screening
Exclusion Criteria:
- Positive test for HIV, Hepatitis B, or Hepatitis C.
- Treatment with known enzyme altering drugs.
- History of allergic or adverse response to oxcarbazepne or any other comparable or similar product.

responsible_party.name_title: Elizabeth Ernst, Director, Drug Regulatory Affairs and Medical Affairs
